remarks: Statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2:  "If n > 1, then the number of closed n-walks v(0) ... v(n-2) v(n-1) v(n) from v = v(0) = v(n) with v(n-2) = v is kf(n-2)".  Since ` <. V , E >. ` is k-regular, the vertex v(n-2) = v has k neighbors v(n-1), so there are k walks from v(n-2) = v to v(n) = v (via each of v's neighbors) completing each of the f(n-2) walks from v=v(0) to v(n-2)=v.  This theorem holds even for k=0, but only for finite graphs!  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Sep-2018.)
